org.dhbw.geo.database

Class DBAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dhbw.geo.database.DBObject
      • org.dhbw.geo.database.DBAction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DBActionBrightness, DBActionMessage, DBActionNotification, DBActionSimple, DBActionSound

    public abstract class DBAction
extends DBObject
    An action is a task which can be executed. Every action is assigned to a rule. The specific action can be to turn on wifi etc.
    Author:
    Matthias

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      the flag whether the rule is active This is a user setting whether the action should be fired at all.
      private DBRule rule
      the rule the action is assigned to

    • Field Detail

      • rule

        private DBRule rule
        the rule the action is assigned to

      • active

        private boolean active
        the flag whether the rule is active This is a user setting whether the action should be fired at all. It doesn't represent whether the action has been started!

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBAction

        public DBAction()

      • DBAction

        public DBAction(long id,
                boolean active)
        Creates a new action with a given id. Use this to create actions fetched from a database.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the object in the database
        active - the flag whether the action is activated

    • Method Detail

      • selectAllFromDB

        public static java.util.ArrayList<DBAction> selectAllFromDB(long ruleId)
        Selects all actions from the sqlite database which are assigned to a given rule.
        Parameters:
        ruleId - the id of the rule
        Returns:
        an arraylist of the actions fetched from the database

      • doActionStart

        protected abstract void doActionStart()
        Starts / Performs the specific action. It is used by doActionStart().

      • startAction

        public void startAction()
        Starts / Performs the specific action, if the active flag is true.
        See Also:
        doActionStart()
